item.title: End of an Era
item.description:
When I started university in September 2021, I set myself a goal: to achieve a First Class degree, no matter what it took. Itâ€™s been almost four years since then, and today Iâ€™ve been notified that I have officially obtained that grade. It feels great â€” it may be an undergraduate degree, but I still consider it a colossal achievement.

What Iâ€™ve come to realise, though, is that when you know well in advance that you’re on track to hit your target, it slightly dampens the satisfaction when your final grade is actually released â€” because, in effect, you already know what youâ€™ve achieved. Nevertheless, Iâ€™m proud to have earned a full honours degree, even though university often felt like going through the fire and flames.
